content: <?xml version="1.0"?> <Play xmlns:xsd="Play.xsd" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" id="phoenixturtle" name="Phoenix and the Turtle">   <Act number="1">     <Scene number="1">       <Paragraphs>         <ParagraphType>b</ParagraphType>         <WorkID>phoenixturtle</WorkID>         <Section>1</Section>         <PlainText>           <Line number="1">Let the bird of loudest lay,</Line>           <Line number="2">On the sole Arabian tree,</Line>           <Line number="3">Herald sad and trumpet be,</Line>           <Line number="4">To whose sound chaste wings obey.</Line>         </PlainText>         <PhoneticText>LT 0 BRT OF LTST L ON 0 SL ARBN TR HRLT ST ANT TRMPT B T HS SNT XST WNKS OB </PhoneticText>         <WordCount>22</WordCount>         <CharCount>125</CharCount>         <Chapter>1</Chapter>         <StemText>let the bird of loudest lai on the sole arabian tree herald sad and trumpet be to whose sound chast wing obei </StemText>         <ParagraphID>656626</ParagraphID>         <ParagraphNum>3</ParagraphNum>         <CharID>Poet</CharID>       </Paragraphs>       <Paragraphs>         <ParagraphType>b</ParagraphType>         <WorkID>phoenixturtle</WorkID>         <Section>1</Section>         <PlainText>           <Line number="5">But thou shrieking harbinger,</Line>           <Line number="6">Foul precurrer of the fiend,</Line>           <Line number="7">Augur of the fever's end,</Line>           <Line number="8">To this troop come thou not near!</Line>         </PlainText>         <PhoneticText>BT 0 XRKNK HRBNJR FL PRKRR OF 0 FNT AKR OF 0 FFRS ENT T 0S TRP KM 0 NT NR </PhoneticText>         <WordCount>21</WordCount>         <CharCount>128</CharCount>         <Chapter>1</Chapter>         <StemText>but thou shriek harbing foul precurr of the fiend augur of the fever end to thi troop come thou not near </StemText>         <ParagraphID>656627</ParagraphID>         <ParagraphNum>7</ParagraphNum>         <CharID>Poet</CharID>       </Paragraphs>       <Paragraphs>         <ParagraphType>b</ParagraphType>         <WorkID>phoenixturtle</WorkID>         <Section>1</Section>         <PlainText>           <Line number="9">From this session interdict</Line>           <Line number="10">Every fowl of tyrant wing,</Line>           <Line number="11">Save the eagle, feather'd king:</Line>           <Line number="12">Keep the obsequy so strict.</Line>         </PlainText>         <PhoneticText>FRM 0S SSN INTRTKT EFR FL OF TRNT WNK SF 0 EKL F0RT KNK KP 0 OBSK S STRKT </PhoneticText>         <WordCount>19</WordCount>         <CharCount>124</CharCount>         <Chapter>1</Chapter>         <StemText>from thi session interdict everi fowl of tyrant wing save the eagl featherd king keep the obsequi so strict </StemText>         <ParagraphID>656628</ParagraphID>         <ParagraphNum>11</ParagraphNum>         <CharID>Poet</CharID>       </Paragraphs>       <Paragraphs>         <ParagraphType>b</ParagraphType>         <WorkID>phoenixturtle</WorkID>         <Section>1</Section>         <PlainText>           <Line number="13">Let the priest in surplice white,</Line>           <Line number="14">That defunctive music can,</Line>           <Line number="15">Be the death-divining swan,</Line>           <Line number="16">Lest the requiem lack his right.</Line>         </PlainText>         <PhoneticText>LT 0 PRST IN SRPLS HT 0T TFNKTF MSK KN B 0 T0TFNNK SWN LST 0 RKM LK HS RFT </PhoneticText>         <WordCount>20</WordCount>         <CharCount>131</CharCount>         <Chapter>1</Chapter>         <StemText>let the priest in surplic white that defunct music can be the deathdivin swan lest the requiem lack hi right </StemText>         <ParagraphID>656629</ParagraphID>         <ParagraphNum>15</ParagraphNum>         <CharID>Poet</CharID>       </Paragraphs>       <Paragraphs>         <ParagraphType>b</ParagraphType>         <WorkID>phoenixturtle</WorkID>         <Section>1</Section>         <PlainText>           <Line number="17">And thou treble-dated crow,</Line>           <Line number="18">That thy sable gender makest</Line>           <Line number="19">With the breath thou givest and takest,</Line>           <Line number="20">'Mongst our mourners shalt thou go.</Line>         </PlainText>         <PhoneticText>ANT 0 TRBLTTT KR 0T 0 SBL JNTR MKST W0 0 BR0 0 JFST ANT TKST MNKST OR MRNRS XLT 0 K </PhoneticText>         <WordCount>22</WordCount>         <CharCount>142</CharCount>         <Chapter>1</Chapter>         <StemText>and thou trebled crow that thy sabl gender makest with the breath thou givest and takest mongst our mourner shalt thou go </StemText>         <ParagraphID>656630</ParagraphID>         <ParagraphNum>19</ParagraphNum>         <CharID>Poet</CharID>       </Paragraphs>       <Paragraphs>         <ParagraphType>b</ParagraphType>         <WorkID>phoenixturtle</WorkID>         <Section>1</Section>         <PlainText>           <Line number="21">Here the anthem doth commence:</Line>           <Line number="22">Love and constancy is dead;</Line>           <Line number="23">Phoenix and the turtle fled</Line>           <Line number="24">In a mutual flame from hence.</Line>         </PlainText>         <PhoneticText>HR 0 AN0M T0 KMNS LF ANT KNSTNS IS TT FNKS ANT 0 TRTL FLT IN A MTL FLM FRM HNS </PhoneticText>         <WordCount>21</WordCount>         <CharCount>126</CharCount>         <Chapter>1</Chapter>         <StemText>here the anthem doth commenc love and constanc i dead phoenix and the turtl fled in a mutual flame from henc </StemText>         <ParagraphID>656631</ParagraphID>         <ParagraphNum>23</ParagraphNum>         <CharID>Poet</CharID>       </Paragraphs>       <Paragraphs>         <ParagraphType>b</ParagraphType>         <WorkID>phoenixturtle</WorkID>         <Section>1</Section>         <PlainText>           <Line number="25">So they loved, as love in twain</Line>           <Line number="26">Had the essence but in one;</Line>           <Line number="27">Two distincts, division none:</Line>           <Line number="28">Number there in love was slain.</Line>         </PlainText>         <PhoneticText>S 0 LFT AS LF IN TWN HT 0 ESNS BT IN ON TW TSTNKTS TFXN NN NMR 0R IN LF WS SLN </PhoneticText>         <WordCount>23</WordCount>         <CharCount>131</CharCount>         <Chapter>1</Chapter>         <StemText>so thei love a love in twain had the essenc but in on two distinct division none number there in love wa slain </StemText>         <ParagraphID>656632</ParagraphID>         <ParagraphNum>27</ParagraphNum>         <CharID>Poet</CharID>       </Paragraphs>       <Paragraphs>         <ParagraphType>b</ParagraphType>         <WorkID>phoenixturtle</WorkID>         <Section>1</Section>         <PlainText>           <Line number="29">Hearts remote, yet not asunder;</Line>           <Line number="30">Distance, and no space was seen</Line>           <Line number="31">'Twixt the turtle and his queen:</Line>           <Line number="32">But in them it were a wonder.</Line>         </PlainText>         <PhoneticText>HRTS RMT YT NT ASNTR TSTNS ANT N SPS WS SN TWKST 0 TRTL ANT HS KN BT IN 0M IT WR A WNTR </PhoneticText>         <WordCount>24</WordCount>         <CharCount>136</CharCount>         <Chapter>1</Chapter>         <StemText>heart remot yet not asund distanc and no space wa seen twixt the turtl and hi queen but in them it were a wonder </StemText>         <ParagraphID>656633</ParagraphID>         <ParagraphNum>31</ParagraphNum>         <CharID>Poet</CharID>       </Paragraphs>       <Paragraphs>         <ParagraphType>b</ParagraphType>         <WorkID>phoenixturtle</WorkID>         <Section>1</Section>         <PlainText>           <Line number="33">So between them love did shine,</Line>           <Line number="34">That the turtle saw his right</Line>           <Line number="35">Flaming in the phoenix' sight;</Line>           <Line number="36">Either was the other's mine.</Line>         </PlainText>         <PhoneticText>S BTWN 0M LF TT XN 0T 0 TRTL S HS RFT FLMNK IN 0 FNKS SFT E0R WS 0 O0RS MN </PhoneticText>         <WordCount>22</WordCount>         <CharCount>131</CharCount>         <Chapter>1</Chapter>         <StemText>so between them love did shine that the turtl saw hi right flame in the phoenix sight either wa the other mine </StemText>         <ParagraphID>656634</ParagraphID>         <ParagraphNum>35</ParagraphNum>         <CharID>Poet</CharID>       </Paragraphs>       <Paragraphs>         <ParagraphType>b</ParagraphType>         <WorkID>phoenixturtle</WorkID>         <Section>1</Section>         <PlainText>           <Line number="37">Property was thus appalled,</Line>           <Line number="38">That the self was not the same;</Line>           <Line number="39">Single nature's double name</Line>           <Line number="40">Neither two nor one was called.</Line>         </PlainText>         <PhoneticText>PRPRT WS 0S APLT 0T 0 SLF WS NT 0 SM SNKL NTRS TBL NM N0R TW NR ON WS KLT </PhoneticText>         <WordCount>21</WordCount>         <CharCount>129</CharCount>         <Chapter>1</Chapter>         <StemText>properti wa thu appal that the self wa not the same singl natur doubl name neither two nor on wa call </StemText>         <ParagraphID>656635</ParagraphID>         <ParagraphNum>39</ParagraphNum>         <CharID>Poet</CharID>       </Paragraphs>       <Paragraphs>         <ParagraphType>b</ParagraphType>         <WorkID>phoenixturtle</WorkID>         <Section>1</Section>         <PlainText>           <Line number="41">Reason, in itself confounded,</Line>           <Line number="42">Saw division grow together,</Line>           <Line number="43">To themselves yet either neither,</Line>           <Line number="44">Simple were so well compounded,</Line>         </PlainText>         <PhoneticText>RSN IN ITSLF KNFNTT S TFXN KR TJ0R T 0MSLFS YT E0R N0R SMPL WR S WL KMPNTT </PhoneticText>         <WordCount>18</WordCount>         <CharCount>133</CharCount>         <Chapter>1</Chapter>         <StemText>reason in itself confound saw division grow togeth to themselv yet either neither simpl were so well compound </StemText>         <ParagraphID>656636</ParagraphID>         <ParagraphNum>43</ParagraphNum>         <CharID>Poet</CharID>       </Paragraphs>       <Paragraphs>         <ParagraphType>b</ParagraphType>         <WorkID>phoenixturtle</WorkID>         <Section>1</Section>         <PlainText>           <Line number="45">That it cried, How true a twain</Line>           <Line number="46">Seemeth this concordant one!</Line>           <Line number="47">Love hath reason, reason none,</Line>           <Line number="48">If what parts can so remain.</Line>         </PlainText>         <PhoneticText>0T IT KRT H TR A TWN SM0 0S KNKRTNT ON LF H0 RSN RSN NN IF HT PRTS KN S RMN </PhoneticText>         <WordCount>22</WordCount>         <CharCount>130</CharCount>         <Chapter>1</Chapter>         <StemText>that it cri how true a twain seemeth thi concord on love hath reason reason none if what part can so remain </StemText>         <ParagraphID>656637</ParagraphID>         <ParagraphNum>47</ParagraphNum>         <CharID>Poet</CharID>       </Paragraphs>       <Paragraphs>         <ParagraphType>b</ParagraphType>         <WorkID>phoenixturtle</WorkID>         <Section>1</Section>         <PlainText>           <Line number="49">Whereupon it made this threne</Line>           <Line number="50">To the phoenix and the dove,</Line>           <Line number="51">Co-supremes and stars of love,</Line>           <Line number="52">As chorus to their tragic scene.</Line>         </PlainText>         <PhoneticText>HRPN IT MT 0S 0RN T 0 FNKS ANT 0 TF KSPRMS ANT STRS OF LF AS XRS T 0R TRJK SN </PhoneticText>         <WordCount>22</WordCount>         <CharCount>132</CharCount>         <Chapter>1</Chapter>         <StemText>whereupon it made thi threne to the phoenix and the dove cosuprem and star of love a choru to their tragic scene </StemText>         <ParagraphID>656638</ParagraphID>         <ParagraphNum>51</ParagraphNum>         <CharID>Poet</CharID>       </Paragraphs>       <Paragraphs>         <ParagraphType>b</ParagraphType>         <WorkID>phoenixturtle</WorkID>         <Section>1</Section>         <PlainText>           <Line number="53">THRENOS.</Line>         </PlainText>         <PhoneticText>0RNS </PhoneticText>         <WordCount>1</WordCount>         <CharCount>9</CharCount>         <Chapter>1</Chapter>         <StemText>threno </StemText>         <ParagraphID>656639</ParagraphID>         <ParagraphNum>55</ParagraphNum>         <CharID>Poet</CharID>       </Paragraphs>       <Paragraphs>         <ParagraphType>b</ParagraphType>         <WorkID>phoenixturtle</WorkID>         <Section>1</Section>         <PlainText>           <Line number="54">Beauty, truth, and rarity,</Line>           <Line number="55">Grace in all simplicity,</Line>           <Line number="56">Here enclosed in cinders lie.</Line>         </PlainText>         <PhoneticText>BT TR0 ANT RRT KRS IN AL SMPLST HR ENKLST IN SNTRS L </PhoneticText>         <WordCount>13</WordCount>         <CharCount>88</CharCount>         <Chapter>1</Chapter>         <StemText>beauti truth and rariti grace in all simplic here enclos in cinder lie </StemText>         <ParagraphID>656640</ParagraphID>         <ParagraphNum>56</ParagraphNum>         <CharID>Poet</CharID>       </Paragraphs>       <Paragraphs>         <ParagraphType>b</ParagraphType>         <WorkID>phoenixturtle</WorkID>         <Section>1</Section>         <PlainText>           <Line number="57">Death is now the phoenix' nest</Line>           <Line number="58">And the turtle's loyal breast</Line>           <Line number="59">To eternity doth rest,</Line>         </PlainText>         <PhoneticText>T0 IS N 0 FNKS NST ANT 0 TRTLS LYL BRST T ETRNT T0 RST </PhoneticText>         <WordCount>15</WordCount>         <CharCount>90</CharCount>         <Chapter>1</Chapter>         <StemText>death i now the phoenix nest and the turtl loyal breast to etern doth rest </StemText>         <ParagraphID>656641</ParagraphID>         <ParagraphNum>59</ParagraphNum>         <CharID>Poet</CharID>       </Paragraphs>       <Paragraphs>         <ParagraphType>b</ParagraphType>         <WorkID>phoenixturtle</WorkID>         <Section>1</Section>         <PlainText>           <Line number="60">Leaving no posterity:</Line>           <Line number="61">'Twas not their infirmity,</Line>           <Line number="62">It was married chastity.</Line>         </PlainText>         <PhoneticText>LFNK N PSTRT TWS NT 0R INFRMT IT WS MRT XSTT </PhoneticText>         <WordCount>11</WordCount>         <CharCount>80</CharCount>         <Chapter>1</Chapter>         <StemText>leav no poster twa not their infirm it wa marri chastiti </StemText>         <ParagraphID>656642</ParagraphID>         <ParagraphNum>62</ParagraphNum>         <CharID>Poet</CharID>       </Paragraphs>       <Paragraphs>         <ParagraphType>b</ParagraphType>         <WorkID>phoenixturtle</WorkID>         <Section>1</Section>         <PlainText>           <Line number="63">Truth may seem, but cannot be:</Line>           <Line number="64">Beauty brag, but 'tis not she;</Line>           <Line number="65">Truth and beauty buried be.</Line>         </PlainText>         <PhoneticText>TR0 M SM BT KNT B BT BRK BT TS NT X TR0 ANT BT BRT B </PhoneticText>         <WordCount>17</WordCount>         <CharCount>96</CharCount>         <Chapter>1</Chapter>         <StemText>truth mai seem but cannot be beauti brag but ti not she truth and beauti buri be </StemText>         <ParagraphID>656643</ParagraphID>         <ParagraphNum>65</ParagraphNum>         <CharID>Poet</CharID>       </Paragraphs>       <Paragraphs>         <ParagraphType>b</ParagraphType>         <WorkID>phoenixturtle</WorkID>         <Section>1</Section>         <PlainText>           <Line number="66">To this urn let those repair</Line>           <Line number="67">That are either true or fair</Line>           <Line number="68">For these dead birds sigh a prayer.</Line>         </PlainText>         <PhoneticText>T 0S URN LT 0S RPR 0T AR E0R TR OR FR FR 0S TT BRTS SF A PRYR </PhoneticText>         <WordCount>19</WordCount>         <CharCount>99</CharCount>         <Chapter>1</Chapter>         <StemText>to thi urn let those repair that ar either true or fair for these dead bird sigh a prayer </StemText>         <ParagraphID>656644</ParagraphID>         <ParagraphNum>68</ParagraphNum>         <CharID>Poet</CharID>       </Paragraphs>     </Scene>   </Act> </Play>
